FuncDef:
The intelligent-anomaly-detection enable command enables intelligent exception identification.
By default, intelligent exception identification is not enabled.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To check whether a device is abnormal, run this command to enable intelligent exception identification. After this command is run, the system reports an alarm when detecting an exception.
Precautions
If you run this command to configure intelligent exception identification on an unsupported chassis, a message is displayed indicating that the function is not supported.Intelligent exception identification is supported only on devices equipped with main control boards with a memory capacity of 4 GB or higher. If you run this command to configure forwarding plane exception detection on an unsupported device, a message is displayed indicating that the function is not supported.If you run this command to configure intelligent exception identification on a device whose main control boards do not meet CPU performance requirements, a message is displayed indicating that the function is not supported.
